text:
Some areas that may assist: 
Known issues with Microsoft Intune - Intune | Microsoft Learn
 
Fix SCCM Scan Failed To Add Update Source For WUAgent | ConfigMgr HTMD Blog
(anoopcnair.com)
 
Registry.pol file corrupt 
C:\windows\system32\group policy\machine\registry.pol (delete or rename) 
In some cases we just delete the entire contents of the local group policy cache
(everything within the Group policy folder) and force it to re-pull policy. I
suspect that something in the data store folder is corrupt in those cases
besides the registry.pol within machine. 
If using, Re-install the SCCM/MCM client. 
Enablement package updates for the OS solved most of our issues, but we found
issues with Full Feature updates not always completing fully and either not
cleaning up windows.old folder or not turning component like BITS back on. 
Ran dism and sfc scans to repair with reboots. 
Make sure you’re not setting any conflicting registry or policy settings between
the systems (Many older recommendations from SCCM 2012 are no longer applicable
or recommended) 
Do you have Deadlines set in Intune? 
We also found that devices not forced to reboot (at some point) were more likely
to have issues. 
EEK
%40wecenergygroup.com

metadata.subject: RE: [patchmanagement]
